result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky R Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder- While committing Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA sample, all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges and restitution.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victims family or Keonte B.

supervisions.notes: $6,855.00 payable to Tamiko H., joint and several with Charlie Johnson  15CF277; and $1,435.50 payable to the State.

charges.descr: Felony Murder- While committing Armed Robbery

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky R Allen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: reflects correction to original rest amount of $1,435.00  entered in CCAP ($1,435.50 was ordered) copies to DOC cashiers
Original Transcript (37 pages) commencing 07/09/2015 SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT received and filed.
Letter from State Public Defender indicating that a lawyer cannot be appointed because the defendant did not establish financial eligibility.
COPY OF NOTICE OF INTENT, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to the State Public Defender's Office in Madison.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Court ordered restitution in the amount of $6,855 payable to Tamiko H., joint and several with Charlie Johnson 15CF277, and restitution in the amount of $1,435.50 payable to the state.

Defendant Ricky R Allen in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Defendant Ricky R Allen in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  No additions or corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Tamiko H.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 153 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 20 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-No contact with the victim's family
-No contact with Keonte B. 
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
In support of the defendant, from family members and a teacher. Received and filed.
Received and filed.
Received and filed.
PSI emailed to Atty Reddin and ADA Tiffin.

Defendant Ricky R Allen in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Defendant Ricky R Allen in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS to the charged offense:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Court orders PSI without recommendation and adjourns sentencing to 7-9-2015 at 8:15am.  Defendant is remanded.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney William J. Reddin in court, defendant Ricky R Allen not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has received the final offer of settlement from the state.  Defense is requesting that matter be set for plea on 5-28-2015.
TOT Justicepoint with GPS monitoring.

Defendant Ricky R Allen in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Defendant Ricky R Allen in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have entered into a stipulation as to modification of bail.
The court will grant the stipulation and orders the cash bail modified to $25,000.00 TOT Justicepoint with GPS monitoring.
Conditions: absolute sobriety; no contact with Keonte B and Tairerica W.; release for medical/dental appointments; legal contacts; church
Stipulation and Order signed by the court.
Stipulation for Bail Modification has been filed.  Case is set for hearing on 4-13-2015 at 8:15am.  Counsels advised of date and time.  Defendant to be produced from CJF.

Scheduling conference held.  Co-defendant's case is set for 4-23-15 for FPT and 6-1-2015 for JT.  Cases cannot be tried together due to inculpatory statement.  Case set for final pretrial on 4-23-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 68-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-30-2015. Any evidentiary hearing will be held on FPT.

Defendant Ricky R Allen in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Defendant Ricky R Allen in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense motion to modify bail argued and denied by the court.

Defendant Ricky R Allen in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Defendant Ricky R Allen in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Prior: 5820 N 36th St, Milwaukee, WI 53224

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KEONTE B. AND TAIRERICA W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ricky R Allen in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Ricky R Allen in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
